title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.3 IMPROVED LEARNING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: Output: 3.3: School functionality and child-friendly learning environment are improved, including for most vulnerable children, girls and adolescents, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, sustained quality access for girls and boys to equitable and inclusive education opportunities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output: 3.3: School functionality and child-friendly learning environment are improved, including for most vulnerable children,girls and adolescents

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF continued to support the education sector in Yemen maintain a minimum standard of quality in its schools, by strengthening capacities for school-level planning and management of the school grants programme (7583 schools – 100% of target achieved), support to 2,362 teachers (2,232 female) (2.7% of target - 86,000 teachers), rehabilitation of WASH facilities in 188 schools (rounded 38% of target) and academic supervision in 7583 schools. A key constraint within this output was resource mobilization for teacher incentives; this is despite major advocacy and outreach efforts by YCO (Global Consultation on Education Needs in Yemen, Education Disrupted). | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:13/01/2022
